blocks.content: My second weekend trip in Japan was a Fuji bullet hike. We had to go before the short summer hiking window closed. Like most tall landmarks, the best views of Fuji are from far away.

photos.caption: Closed storefront catching the cool blue hour.

blocks.content: At the top of Fuji we took shelter from the biting winds inside a small wooden shack. Hikers huddled at the top desperately clinging onto bowls of miso soup for warmth. The server ushered some locals to sit next to us. He directed them vaguely in our direction and whispered for them to sit next to gaijan-sama.
